Define Documentation

#define ACTIVATION_THRESHOLD   1.e-3

below this threshold, no data is added to a rf (just a speed up)

Function Documentation

int addDataToLWPRCompControl ( int  ID,
Vector  x,
Vector  u,
Vector  y,
int  flag,
int *  rfID,
Vector  y_pred,
Vector  tracking_error,
double  tracking_error_gain 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
addDataToLWPRCompControl
Date:
March 2003
Remarks:
Customized function for adding data for a model used in composite control. All it does is to do an input vector expansion for linear g(x) terms, as specified in the LWPR structure.

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] ID : the ID of the LWPR
[in] x : the input state vector
[in] u : the input control vector
[in] y : the output vector
[in] flag : FALSE if y is an output, TRUE if y is an error
[in,out] rfID : neighborhood rfID for input, max activated rfID for output
[out] y_pred : the prediction for the current training point after updating
[in] tracking_error : the tracking error per output
[in] tracking_error_gain,: the gain for tracking error updates

Definition at line 697 of file lwpr.c.

int initLWPR ( int  n_in_w,
int  n_in_reg,
int  n_in_reg_2nd,
int  n_out,
int  n_out_2nd,
int  diag_only,
int  meta,
double  meta_rate,
double  penalty,
double  init_alpha,
Vector  norm_in_w,
Vector  norm_in_reg,
Vector  norm_in_reg_2nd,
Vector  norm_out,
Vector  norm_out_2nd,
char *  name,
int  ID,
LWPR *  ini 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
initLWPR
Date:
November, 1994
Remarks:
Initiates a lwpr model with all mandatory values and default values otherwise. The default values can be changed by dedicated functions.

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] n_in_w : number of input dimensions for weights
[in] n_in_reg : number of input dimensions for regression
[in] n_in_reg_2nd : number of input dimensions for 2nd regression (0=no 2nd model)
[in] n_out : number of output dimensions for regression
[in] n_out_2nd : number of output dimensions for 2nd regression
[in] diag_only : TRUE/FALSE to update only the diagonal distance metric
[in] meta : TRUE/FALSE to allow the use of a meta learning parameter
[in] meta_rate : the meta learning rate
[in] penalty : a smoothness bias, usually a pretty small number (1.e-4)
[in] init_alpha : the initial learning rates
[in] norm_in_w : the normalization of the inputs for weights
[in] norm_in_reg : the normalization of the inputs for regression
[in] norm_in_reg_2nd : the normalization of the inputs for 2nd regression
[in] norm_out : the normalization of the outputs for regression
[in] norm_out_2nd : the normalization of the outputs for 2nd regression
[in] name : a name for the model
[in] ID : the id to be assigned to this LWPR model
[in] ini : an LWPR structure to initialize the scalar values (pass NULL for default initialization)

Definition at line 142 of file lwpr.c.

double predictLWPROutputConf ( int  ID,
double *  x_w,
double *  x,
double  cutoff,
int  blend,
double *  y,
int *  rfID,
double *  conf 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
predictLWPROutput
Date:
January, 1994
Remarks:
generates a prediction from a given input

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] ID : the ID of the LWPR
[in] x_w : the input vector for weights
[in] x : the input vector for regression
[in] cutoff : a number between [0,1] which indicates at which threshold a receptive field is not used for averaging anymore
[in] blend : blend predictions or use max only
[out] y : the output vector
[in,out] rfID : the rf for the neighborhood for input, returns the max activated rf
returns the max activation contributing to this output

Definition at line 5920 of file lwpr.c.

double predictLWPROutputPartCompControl ( int  ID,
double *  x,
double *  u,
double  cutoff,
int  blend,
int  n_part,
int **  partmat,
double **  y,
int *  rfID 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
predictLWPROutputPartCompControl
Date:
March 2003
Remarks:
A special wrapper for using predictLWPROutputPart for composite control that splits the input vector into x and u components. The partition matrix, however, needs to be provided correctly for the entire (potentially augmented) input vector consisting of [x x*u' u 1].

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] ID : the ID of the LWPR
[in] x : the input state vector
[in] u : the input controlvector
[in] cutoff : a number between [0,1] which indicates at which threshold a receptive field is not used for averaging anymore
[in] blend : blend predictions or use max only
[in] n_part : number of partitions (=number of rows in partition matrix)
[in] partmat,: partition matrix
[out] y : the output **matrix** (one column for every partition)
[in,out] rfID : the rf for the neighborhood for input, returns the max activated rf
returns the max activation contributing to this output

February 1996
Remarks:

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] fname : name of the script
[in] new_flag,: TRUE = force the creation of a new LWPR FALSE = try to read the LWPR from file first
[in] ID : which ID number should this LWPR have

Definition at line 559 of file lwpr_script.c.

int readLWPRScriptMulti ( char *  fname,
int  new_flag,
int *  IDs,
char **  names,
int  n_models 
)

*****************************************************************************

Note:
readLWPRScriptMulti
Date:
February 1996
Remarks:
Reads multiple LWPR models using only one script file, i.e., assuming that the models share all the parameters except for the name.

Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output

Parameters:
[in] fname : name of the script
[in] new_flag,: TRUE = force the creation of a new LWPR FALSE = try to read the LWPR from file first
[in] IDs : array of which ID number should be given to the lwprs
[in] names : names of the lwpr models (pass NULL to use lwpr_name from script file -- but this is only useful for initializing one model)
[in] n_models,: number of models to be initialized
